text: Stan Brock (April 21, 1936 – August 29, 2018) was a British philanthropist. He founded the charity Remote Area Medical in 1985. The Independent states his work rescued millions of uninsured Americans. He was very critical of the American healthcare system. Brock was born in Preston, Lancashire, England. Brock died at RAM Headquarters in Rockford, Tennessee, on August 29, 2018 from a heart attack at the age of 82. ==References== ==Other websites== *Stan Brock interview in Guernica Magazine *Stan Brock's biography at Remote Area Medical * *Interview with former host of Mutual of Omaha’s Wild Kingdom and founder of Remote Area Medical, Stan Brock *PR Newswire RAM Founder to Receive 2010 Inamori Ethics Prize at Case Western Reserve University Category:British philanthropists Category:British television presenters Category:People from Preston, Lancashire Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:1936 births Category:2018 deaths
